biotools.summary: ClipSV (Structural variation detection with clipped reads) is a tool for improving structural variation detection by read extension, spliced alignment and tree-based decision rules. ClipSV was developed to detect structural variations by read extension, spliced alignment and local assembly. It primarily depends on clipped reads from short-read sequencing platform. ClipSV was optimized to discover INDELS (5bp-50bp) and structural variations (>=50bp) in human genomes.
